title: 103_hr5034
content: SECTION 1. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amendments are made to the Foreign Relations Authorization Act and the Act regulating passports, including changes to include the Administrator of the Agency for International Development and specify employees. Amendments to the Foreign Relations Authorization Act include changes such as specifying employees and updating references to serious injury and property destruction. Amendments to the State Department Basic Authorities Act and the Foreign Relations Authorization Act include changes to the roles of the Secretary of State and Deputy Secretary of State, as well as updates to negotiation duties. The Omnibus Diplomatic Security and Antiterrorism Act of 1986 is amended to update negotiation duties and roles within the State Department. The Omnibus Diplomatic Security and Antiterrorism Act of 1986 is amended to update negotiation duties and roles within the State Department. In Title II - Personnel, changes are made to sections 201 and 203, now referred to as "Diplomatic Security Service" and "Special agents" respectively. Section 162 of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995 is amended to change a subsection reference. Section 179 of the same Act is also amended to update language regarding career appointments. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 is further amended to clarify provisions related to United States citizens hired abroad. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to clarify provisions for United States citizens hired abroad, including changes to employment eligibility and citizenship requirements. The Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995, is amended in various sections to make changes such as correcting grammar, updating terminology, and refining language in different provisions. The Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995, is amended to authorize the Secretary of State to use $2,500,000 for purchasing real property in Miami. Amendments include changes in subsections related to the United Nations and its affiliated agencies. The Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995, is amended to authorize the Secretary of State to use $2,500,000 for purchasing real property in Miami. Amendments include changes in subsections related to the United Nations and its affiliated agencies. Additionally, the Voice of America broadcasts must be accurate, objective, and comprehensive to win the attention and respect of listeners. The Foreign Relations Authorization Act of 1994 and 1995 is amended to ensure accurate and comprehensive Voice of America broadcasts. Amendments include adjustments to various sections related to United Nations activities and passport issuance. Amendments to various sections of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act of 1994 and 1995 include increased appropriations and expanded agencies for international development and information dissemination. The Director of the United States Information Agency is authorized to administer au pair programs through fiscal year 1995 in accordance with the Mutual Educational and Cultural Exchange Act of 1961. Regulations will be promulgated for these programs. Additionally, a study of democracy effectiveness is added to the Foreign Relations Authorization Act. Section 101(b) of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995 is amended to update references. Section 701 of the Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to change the section caption. Sections 134, 139, and 140 of the same Act are also amended for various changes. The Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995, is amended in various sections. For example, subsection (o)(3)(B) of Section 162 is updated, and Section 529 is modified to replace "Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty" with "Treaty on the Nonproliferation of Nuclear Weapons." Additionally, the table of contents of the Immigration and Nationality Act is revised to include a new section on the powers and duties of the Secretary of State. Section 164(b) of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995 is amended to include "of 1962" after "Migration and Refugee Assistance Act". Section 173(c) is amended to add "United States" before "Arms Control and Disarmament Agency". Section 309(b) of the Foreign Service Act of 1980 is modified by removing a phrase and adding clarification. Section 611 is amended by changing the heading to "Reductions in Force". Section 611 is amended to address Reductions in Force. The PLO Commitments Compliance Act of 1989 is also amended to update references in specific sections. The Middle East Peace Facilitation Act of 1994 is amended to allow funds from the sale of real property assets of RFE/RL in Munich, Germany to be used for relocation costs. Additionally, the Act to reorganize the consular service of the United States is updated. The Middle East Peace Facilitation Act of 1994 is amended to allow funds from the sale of real property assets of RFE/RL in Munich, Germany to be used for relocation costs. Furthermore, the Act of August 18, 1856 is amended to allow the Secretary of State to designate any other employee to perform notarial functions. The curr_chunk is about the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States also serving as the President of the Senate.
